column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Resolve Your Delicate Mind
#Text=Your own mind is the only entity that you can depend on , trust and speak with freely and calmly because your mind is loyal only to you and does not lie to you .
#Text=Your mind is your soul mate .
#Text=Nothing can take that relationship away .
#Text=Sometimes , a mind can become delicate when it experience a sudden shock or trauma .
#Text=Often , those of us who appear to have tough skin on the outside are the most sensitive on the inside .
#Text=This is especially true among men .
#Text=Women tend to be more expressive and open about their feelings , moods , and about themselves .
#Text=Women usually are not ashamed of revealing their feelings or shedding their tears .
#Text=Children ( in general ) have trouble understanding their behavior and tenderness .
#Text=This is seen in children from 12-16 years old .
#Text=Most of them emotionally develop thick skin to protect themselves .
#Text=Some minds are naturally more delicate than others .
#Text=These assertive steps will show you how to resolve and develop your delicate mind that troubles you .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gathering the Scattered You
#Text=Stay calm .
#Text=Staying calm is the most important when your mind is scattered and your heart feels swollen and your head feels heavy .
#Text=By staying calm you improve your reflection and your mind 's reaction .
#Text=Your nervous system becomes stable and you can help your brain and body to function properly .
#Text=To stay calm , breath slowly and deeply .
#Text=With each deep breath you take , your head stress and weight reduces to its initial level , your heart feels light weighted and your brain feels awake .
#Text=The second verbalizing technique is chanting the echoic and metallic chant " Ohm " 108 times .
#Text=It is a Sanskrit sound and mantra of Hindu origin .
#Text=It is important and sacred in various religions such as Hinduism , Buddhism , Jainism and Santana Dharma .
#Text=When the " Ohm " echoes in our ears , we are more stable throughout our entire body .
#Text=Stop weeping .
#Text=Crying about your condition and weeping is the most wrong thing you can ever do .
#Text=One must exert control over their softness .
#Text=By crying a person invites more depression .
#Text=It damns your thinking stream .
#Text=Think of next .
#Text=Every story has a happy end , every life has also ended happily .
#Text=So , it is obvious that every worst condition also has progressive results .
#Text=By piling your hands on one another or staking your head with one is not the solution or even option ever .
#Text=In such circumstances always think of your and everyone 's betterment , by thinking and doing what should be done ahead .
#Text=It has 2 advantages-one is that your thinking process stabilizes .
#Text=Other , your decision making process progresses .
#Text=Gathering the Scattered Everyone
#Text=Make everyone calm .
#Text=In adverse circumstances , you must calm the ones who are high BP patients and low BP patients .

#Text=High BP boils the body and annoys the mind in a way that the thinking stream is resistant to any kind of happiness or other distraction because the person wants to focus at his/her condition and may suffer from any breathing problem and unconsciousness .
#Text=Go to them , grip their shoulders tightly and warm up and rub their hands if they are low BP patients .
#Text=Tell everyone about chanting the mantra OM and long breaths with some cold water .
#Text=Stop weeps of everyone .
#Text=As already told weeping is not the option , stop others from shedding tears .
#Text=Supply them the warmth of your support and some hearty confidence .
#Text=This is because , when you see your loved ones crying , your mind becomes careworn and troubled .
